etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: Числото 'eins' се използва самостоятелно или с съществително ('ein Auto' без -s). При броене следва 'eins, zwei, drei'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Zwei' е числото 2. При даване на телефон или адрес немците често произнасят ясно 'zwei' вместо 'zwo'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: Числото 'drei' се произнася като 'драй'. В сложни числа образува 'dreizehn' (13) и 'dreißig' (30).
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Vier' се произнася 'фиа' и запазва формата си в съставни числа: 'vierzehn', 'vierzig'. При броене използвайте 'eins, zwei, drei, vier'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Fünf' има умлаут ü (произнася се като между 'ю' и 'и'). Внимание при писане на 15: 'fünfzehn'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Sechs' завършва на -chs и се произнася като 'зекс'. В множествени съставки: 'sechzehn', 'sechzig'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Acht' се произнася с мек 'х' [ахт]. В съставни числа 'achtzehn', 'achtzig', 'achtundzwanzig'.
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: Slavic origin word. Related to other South Slavic languages
cultural_note: Numbers in Bulgarian follow Slavic pattern. Gender agreement with counted nouns
notes_bg_to_de: 'Zehn' се произнася [tseːn] и образува сложни числа като 'zehn Uhr' (десет часа).
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Bulgarian word at word level. Pay attention to stress and pronunciation

etymology: From 'един' (one) + 'над десет' (over ten). Literally 'one over ten'.
cultural_note: Bulgarian teens (11-19) add 'надесет'. German writes 11-19 as one word without spaces.
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Единадесет' entsteht aus 'един' + 'надесет'. Betonung: единаде́сет. Merken: zusätzliche Silbe 'на'.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Elf' се произнася кратко [ɛlf] и често обозначава възраст: 'Er ist elf Jahre alt'. Няма умлаут и не се променя в сложни числа като 'elf Uhr'.
linguistic_note_bg_to_de: Stress on единаде́сет. German 'elf' is monosyllabic with [ɛlf].
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Stress on единаде́сет. German 'elf' is monosyllabic with [ɛlf].

etymology: From 'две' (two) + 'над десет' (over ten). Literally 'two over ten'.
cultural_note: Used in both everyday counting and telling the time (e.g., noon).
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Дванадесет' = 'zwölf'. Beachten Sie den Umlaut 'ö' in Deutsch und die Endung '-десет' im Bulgarischen.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Zwölf' е с умлаут ö и произношение [tsvœlf]. В часовник често се казва 'zwölf Uhr'. В съставни числа стои отпред: 'zwölfmal'.

examples.translation: In der Klasse gibt es zwölf Schüler.

linguistic_note_bg_to_de: Stress on дванаде́сет. German 'zwölf' carries Umlaut (ö) and [tsvœlf].
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Stress on дванаде́сет. German 'zwölf' carries Umlaut (ö) and [tsvœlf].

etymology: From 'три' (three) + 'над десет'. Bulgarian pattern parallels German 'drei' + 'zehn'.
cultural_note: Both cultures consider 13 sometimes unlucky, but it is common in daily use.
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: 'Тринадесет' folgt dem Muster Grundzahl + 'надесет'. Betonung auf '-де́-'.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Dreizehn' комбинира 'drei' + 'zehn' и се произнася [ˈdʁaɪ̯tseːn]. Използва се и като прилагателно: 'dreizehn Schüler'.

examples.translation: Der Film beginnt um dreizehn Uhr.

linguistic_note_bg_to_de: Stress on тринаде́сет. German 'dreizehn' keeps 'drei' stem and uses [ˈdʁaɪ̯tseːn].
linguistic_note_de_to_bg: Stress on тринаде́сет. German 'dreizehn' keeps 'drei' stem and uses [ˈdʁaɪ̯tseːn].

cultural_note: Round numbers like 20 are used in pricing and ages (20 години).
notes_de_to_bg: Für Deutschsprachige: Bulgarisch fügt 'десет' an, Deutsch nutzt die Endung '-zig'.
notes_bg_to_de: 'Zwanzig' се пише с 'z' и се произнася [ˈtsvanʦɪç]. В съставни числа (21) немският ред е 'einundzwanzig'.

examples.sentence: Той стана на двадесет миналия месец.
